events.name: Sign the Deed
events.text: You just made the biggest purchase of your life! Congratulations on the purchase of your new house. How will you handle the upcoming costs?

events.name: Losing Someone Close, is Hard to Get Passed
events.text: Today has been a bad day for everyone in your family. Your mother has just passed away within her sleep. So many tears are flowing through your eyes, but you have to stay strong because it is up to you to plan the funeral. Do you have any money put away for times like this?

counteractions.name: Go with a simple funeral, and spend $2,500.
Take out an emergency loan of $5,000.
Go all out for the funeral, and spend $5,000 out of pocket. Your mother deserves the best funeral possible.

events.name: Late Too Many Times
events.text: Your late on your mortgage again. Normally, you are able to pay it at a later time. This time the tables have turned, and you were told to pay your mortagage by the end of the week or you will be forced to leave. Are you going to just let yourself get kicked out or will you do something about it?

counteractions.name: Move to a less expensive place and pay $700 for rent.
Take out a loan of $1,250, for this month mortgage.

events.name: Taxes are Due
events.text: For the passed two years, you have not paid your taxes. You have been struggling to keep up with them, and now you have a limited time to pay them or you will lose the things you have worked so hard for.

counteractions.name: Pay minimum of $2,500 in backpay of your taxes.
Pay the full amount of $5,000 in backpay of your taxes.
Go on a payment plan and pay $250 a month. This will take 20 months for you to pay back back your taxes.

events.name: Debt
events.text: So many of your bills are passed due. You cannot find anyone who can personally help you out.

counteractions.name: Pay off the most expensive debt of $1,202.

events.name: Total Wreck
events.text: You have had your car for 5 years now, and now all of a sudden it just stopped running. It's basically a wreck, but you have spent so much money on your car. Now all that will go to waste, unless you figure something out.

counteractions.name: Buy a new luxury car at the price of $10,000
Use your auto-insurance, to cover your car damages.

events.name: The New Guy/Girl
events.text: You have just graduated, and now you are starting your very first corporate job. Everything is moving extremely fast for you. Your still filling out paperwork at work, and you came across them asking do you have a secure insurance plan for yourself. Realizing that you don't have one at all what should you do about it?

counteractions.name: Choose to recieve term life insurance.
Choose to recieve whole life insurance
You will be okay. There is no need for insurance.

events.name: Wedding Bells!
events.text: Wedding Bells are RINGING! You have just got married, and now your moving into a new house with the one you love. But shouldn't your new house, and everything in it be insured?

counteractions.name: No need for insurance, you will be ok without it.
Get Homeowners insurance, just in case.
My bat will keep us safe from any home invasion.

events.name: Retirement
events.text: You have been working at your job about 10 years now, and you enjoy your job. Your boss asked you if you have a retirement plan. Realizing that you do not have a plan at all, what should you do about this situation?

events.name: Is School For You?
events.text: Ever since you graduated from high school, you have not been sure if you would like to this.persona.name your education. Your parents did not have the money for you to go, but now that your older you take care of yourself. You feel like you just do not have the funds to afford to go to the college that you desire to attend. Do not give up, because there should be something that can come in handy.

counteractions.name: Apply to several grants and recieve $3,000, but pay $2,500 out of pocket.

events.name: Keep Your Legacy Going
events.text: You are getting much older now, and you are unable to do the things that you want to do in life. It's ok, because you have accomplished so much within your lifetime. It would be great if there was a way to set up a financial legacy.

counteractions.name: Leave money to your favorite donation. Leave $25,000.
Leave money to your family. Leave $50,000.

events.name: Updates on your HOME
events.text: Your driverway has a few cracks and holes in it. This makes it hard for you to pull in and out of your garage. You need your driveway fixed ASAP!

counteractions.name: You saved up for things like this. Spend $1,600 from your savings.

events.name: Buying a House
events.text: Your family is getting bigger. This apartment is not going to cut it. You need to consider buying a house for your growing family.

counteractions.name: Take out a loan of $5,000 for a down payment.
Let your family cramp in the apartment.

events.name: Inheritance
events.text: You have finally recieved your inheritance of $10,500. What should you do with it?

events.name: Bills
events.text: Its time to pay your bills, but you do not have enough for all of them. Which bills will you pay?

events.name: Funding for Education.
events.text: Getting money for school is not easy. You did not get all the money you need to pay for school. How will you manage to pay off your education?

events.name: Buy Life Insurance!
events.text: In life you need to make sure that you are insured in case anything happens.

events.name: Buy Health Insurance!
events.text: Anything physically can happen to you. Make sure to have health insurnace.

events.name: Buy Auto Insurance!
events.text: Anything can happen to your car. Don't you think it is best to have it insured?

events.name: Buy HomeOwner's Insurance!
events.text: It is always important to keep your home safe.
